Author: baronofficiall2
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: FOREVER HAS FALLEN Forever Has Fallen is a global transmedia game that focuses on the playing of BlockChain and has a story told on various platforms such as content streaming, web-based content, social media, email and SMS. A transmedia game in Blockchain has tremendous potential and Forever Has Fallen can change our perspective on future video games and media presentations. A blockchain is the basis of almost all crypto currencies. It is a database technology that shares information with accounting and verifying the information. In the case of blockchain gameification, it records transactions and player progress, validates ownership of in-game goods and ownership of collections. Smart contracts written to block chain codes will make it easier to earn revenues within the platform. Forever Token, Forever Has Fallen ecosystem to make it easier to play in the game, will also be the key to the process of playing. Forever Token is likely to be exempt from a number of regulatory mistakes we see in the area of crypto-currency today, because it is created as a service Coini. Using Existing Technologies Forever Has Fallen uses existing technologies to limit the risk. The platform is one of the reasons why it is built on Ethereum, a blockchain established with Dapps and intelligent contracts that are already functioning. Smart contracts will allow interaction between new spouses as they switch users and win prizes. Players will be able to earn Forever Coin by playing games, introducing games, making friends, visiting physical places, or completing tasks. Online / Offline Economy Forever Has Fallen economy will work both online and offline. The online economy will mostly work with the platform Token Forever Coin. Users will be rewarded with Forever Coin when they complete their quests in the game and at the same time will be able to trade Forever Coin with their in-game digital products Forever Coin, or trade Forever Coins on a trading platform or other cryptographic currency. Business Moderated Forever Has Fallen divides the coin allocation into two phases. In stage 1; It allocates 35% of token supply for traditional token buyers. Token sales will increase interest and awareness in the project. In stage 2, it allocates 45% of the token for the community to play the game. This large number of tokens reserved for players; the community and the game grow over time. The founding team will have a locked token allocation for two years, which will encourage the team to deliver the game within 12 months.

It’s as if people have forgotten that all currency is an illusion, shared by everyone who wants to participate in that illusion; we all agree $1 is $1 and trust that of each other. Author: michaelziersch
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: IMPORTANT UPDATE! -  Acting in the best interests of the Forever Has Fallen business, our executive team supports the decision of our CEO/founder Kimon Lycos, to not sell our tokens via a public sale. The overall wild west attitudes still prevail and proceeding with the public token sale would have harmed or even killed the project.   Our world class business model and innovation stands above current ICO offerings. The vast majority of the offerings are catering to people who only want speculation, and not to build anything. The Forever Has Fallen project has always maintained we are community oriented and our strategy is to work with sophisticated/accredited investors to provide the funding and support we require to make this project successful. We owe it to ourselves and to our supporters to take this strategy and move away from the mass of garbage ICOs.   Because our business model does not rely on speculation, we have found this to be at odds with the so-called traditional ‘investor’ community (speculators) and out-of-step with real investors. The Forever Has Fallen concept is a game changer for the game/entertainment industry. Our value proposition to people who buy our tokens requires us to create a market they can sell to. This market we want to create is not one of speculators, but of gamers who want to play our game.    The tokens for our bounty and airdrop campaigns will still be distributed as per previous deadlines and allocations. These campaigns are no longer accepting new participants as from 1 May 2018. Additionally, the tokens will not be listed on exchanges until after the project is launched. While you will have to hold on to them for now, the longer-term perspective ensures the project will continue, prosper and be listed on exchanges in the future. When they are listed, you can count on the price to be quite high and that there will be a market of gamers eager to buy them.   We hope you share the same vision for Forever Has Fallen as we do and that you recognise this decision is in the best interests of the business and for anyone who has ownership of Forever Coin tokens.  Please follow us on twitter and subscribe to the mailing list to stay up to date with the project. https://twitter.com/fhfcommunity http://eepurl.com/dtgnbL

Author: michaelziersch
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: Mihell and Lycos are proud to partner with 42 Entertainment.  Located in Los Angeles, 42 Entertainment is an award winning transmedia production company, renowned for creating unique, immersive experiences. Their body of global work includes the innovative alternate reality game for the Warner Bros. release, The Dark Knight, a mix of entertainment, gaming and technology. They produced the groundbreaking ilovebees campaign for Microsoft's marketing launch of Halo 2. Other projects include Infamous: Second Son's (Sony), Last Call Poker (Activision), Dead Man's Tale (Disney and MSN) and The Vanishing Point.  42 Entertainment has also worked with the music industry, producing the alternate reality experience Year Zero for the launch of Nine Inch Nail's album by the same name.  Have a look at the amazing experiences they have created: http://www.42entertainment.com/work/

Advisors Susan Bonds, President and CEO of 42 Entertainment, https://www.linkedin.com/in/susan-bonds-70828b/  Phil Mayes Founder and Director of Mighty Kingdom https://www.linkedin.com/in/philipmayes/  Alexander Mitrovich Blockchain practice managing partner for UseTech https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexandermitrovich/  Al Jawhari Holding a patent based on blockchain to prevent the counterfeiting of premium food and wine https://www.linkedin.com/in/jawhari/  Adrian Smith Global executive as Australian Managing Director for the German Defence company Rheinmetall. Founder and CEO of Sydac. https://www.linkedin.com/in/adrian-smith-33304377/  Joakim Holmer Technical leadership positions with telecommunications giant Ericsson, with a passion for communications and new technologies. https://www.linkedin.com/in/joakimholmer/  Anastasia Haysom Varpenius Entrepreneur in the IT & manufacturing industries. Anastasia has over 15 years of experience in global business development & sales and marketing. https://www.linkedin.com/in/anastasiahaysom/  Ralf Gerteis A highly experienced executive with a global outlook, Ralf provides an exceptional level of strategy and understanding of how to structure commercially driven technology projects. https://www.linkedin.com/in/ralf-gerteis-1765aa24/  Anders Larsson Extensive global career in mobile telecommunications, working with engineering and technology since 2G networks. https://www.linkedin.com/in/anders-larsson/  Bogdan Fiedur Has been creating Smart Contracts and working with blockchain since 2016. Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: Hi Ivsca. The game launch is planned for 1 year from now, Q2 2018 and we will have some prototype experiences out before then, but we don't have any particular date announcements that we can make.  Since we are making a transmedia game, where the story and the way that it is communicated to the players is critical, we are hesitant to release too many spoilers that could ruin the fun.  To see examples of the games that have been made by our team in the past, look at our partners previous work history here: http://www.42entertainment.com/work/ilovebees  In particular, the 'why so serious', 'i love bees' and 'year zero' games that we have made previously are examples of the direction that we are heading.

Author: michaelziersch
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: Take a look at our technology partner UseTech - Global leaders in specialised development of blockchain platforms and systems integration for enterprises.  Here is a blurb about their expertise: UseTech's 250+ team has deep expertise in wide variety of technologies. Their Blockchain practice, for example, covers all major technologies in that space and often deploys niche ones for specific use cases. They help their enterprise clients to achieve their business goals by supporting their build up of flexible architecture and by designing consumer touchpoints for an increasing number of complex use cases. In architecture they support their client’s enhancements of their SOA, Micro Services or PaaS platforms to create flexible capabilities that can embrace quick and frequent changes to their business process automation. For example they enabled their clients to introduce digital price tags, new consumer mobile apps and real time inventory to their e-commerce OMS as well as to POS software.  http://usetech.com/  Visit our website https://foreverhasfallen.com/ for the full list of partners.

Author: calem
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: I live in the same city as some of the other team members. Been chatting on and off with em and soon enough I hope I'll be meeting the team in person. When I do, I'll gladly put my neck out for the project and go from 85% keen to 99% keen on this..  With 42 Entertainment running marketing... This is going to be the single biggest gaming based project to date that use BC tech, in ways, not even BTC can be utilised as at the moment.  42 Entertainment have run campaigns for the likes of Sony's INFAMOUS, Wrigley, The Dark Knight, Nine Inch Nails for Trent Reznor, TRON LEGACY, Age Of Extinction, Amazing Spider-Man, Halo 2, Pirates Of The Carribean and the list just goes on..  Another key point I noticed, the team are locking themselves out from claiming their own tokens for 2 years after release.  So yeah. Been a local to this project, I'll gladly vet these guys for the community with my own eyes and a handshake.

Author: ColorlessK
Title: [ANN][ICO]Forever Has Fallen - Blockchain gamification using transmedia
Body: Quote from: blurryeyed on April 03, 2018, 12:07:24 PM   Quote from: blurryeyed on April 03, 2018, 11:59:44 AM   So let's get a few things straight.  1. This is beyond childish. You posted a negative review, which literally anyone can do without it being true whatsoever. 2. You then screenshotted your own review and use it as an argument, I don't even want to start on this. 3. I have absolutely no connection to Ambisafe whatsoever. 4. To date my team has distributed over $15.000.000 in Bounties, what have you done? 5. I have paid participants from my own pocket countless times when ICOs refused to do so. You got it mate. I'm paying people myself because I'm a scam. Too bad there's no clap emoticon on btctalk. 6. I had run Worldcore Bounty more than 3 months ago and did it so at the request of the team. Everyone was paid. And besides, they only worked with Ambisafe for a short amount of time, until they fired them to work with us(just in case you don't see the flaw in your logic here)   Now, leaving all of those things aside, you tried to pull this thing again a few months ago when you gave me a review from one of your other accounts "IconFirm" - to which I responded and it is why that account is now red-trusted.  So then you went and created a new account and gave over 200 bad reviews to random people for bogus reasons.  Now you come and accuse me with over 36+ green trust of another bogus invented thing. You are ludicrous mate. Also, since we're making photos anyway.   First, the red trust ratings you have on this account:   Second, the red trust ratings you have on the old account:   Now, besides the fact that you literally positive trusted your own accounts and it is so obvious that even a toddler could realize it.  Let's look at my trust ratings. Let's completely drop the fact that I have a +36 green trust rating and you have -2 red rating on most accounts  In all my history I have received 3 bad reviews. 2 of them are from your accounts(Iconfirm and this) and the third one is from a newbie with literally 0 posts on the forum, received more than 6 months ago.  However, there's quite some people who offered a positive feedback. With risked money and references. From trusted users of the forum. Several times.  As seen here:      Bonus Comparison:    Also, a reference thread, just so everyone can see that you were busted by one of the most trusted legendary members around, several times: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1064824.0   You really should find something better to do. It is just a matter of time until all of your 28 alt accounts will get banned anyway.
